newsitem.title: INDIA: India Thomas Cook down 9 pct after bonus.
newsitem.headline: India Thomas Cook down 9 pct after bonus.

text.p: Shares of travel and leisure firm Thomas Cook India on Tuesday fell 100.75 rupees, or nearly nine percent, to 1,050 rupees at the Bombay exchange as traders booked profits after the firm announced a bonus issue.
"The buying euphoria in the stock is over," said a dealer at a foreign brokerage. Thomas Cook, at a board meeting on Monday decided to offer shareholders two bonus shares for every three shares held.
Thomas Cook shares have surged nearly 25 percent in the past three weeks on speculation over the issue.

The company on Monday announced a 26 percent jump in its full year net profit to 136.5 million in the period ending December 1996. The firm's income rose 21 percent to 524.7 million as compared to 432.6 million in 1995.
